fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24135].
  {panel}

In our JBoss Application Server project (https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBAS) we are well in progress on our seventh major version with several thousand issues historically.  Over this time, components (and their default assignees) have changed substantially from what existed in prior versions, making the list of components increasingly stagnant and useless.  Some degree of separation between major versions is essential yet it would still be nice to be able to apply an issue to more than one major version, while listing the components affected in each major version (which may differ somewhat between major versions).

The only solution we have is to create a new project for every major version, but this has many downsides.

What would work much better is to have a new field "Major Version" which defines a separate category of components and versions.  In other words, each major version ("6.x", "7.x", etc.) would contain a version set ("6.1.0", "6.1.1", etc.) as well as its own set of components.

Please give this issue some consideration - I know that this type of issue has been raised before (in a different form e.g. subcomponents) but hopefully this solution is somewhat more viable.
fields.summary: Special support for "Major Versions"

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Create at least 6 new projects in JIRA and some issue types - just as long to make it the project and issue type list longer than the quick create issue box.
# Using Firefox and clicking on either the project or issue type list, no matter how long the scroll and search is, the quick create issue box will not be closed automatically.
# However, using IE 8 and clicking on either the project or issue type list, scrolling for about *10-20 seconds*, the quick create issue box *will be closed automatically*. This is also happening to IE 7 browser. 
|

By default in either Firefox or IE browser, if the mouse cursor is outside the quick create issue box for approximately 10-15 seconds, it will be closed automatically. 

However, for this bug report, if we have thousands of projects or issue types in JIRA and while the user is searching for the right project to create, it will be quite annoying if the quick create issue box closes automatically.
fields.summary: Quick Create Issue Box will be closed automatically after 10-20 seconds while browsing project or issue type in IE browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24133].
  {panel}

JIRA does not currently support connecting to load-balanced AD servers.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/User+Management+Limitations+and+Recommendations
About half-way down:

"#2) Synchronising between AD servers is not supported. Microsoft Active Directory does not replicate the uSNChanged attribute across instances. For that reason, we do not support connecting to different AD servers for synchronisation."

Many companies have a single DNS entry (mydomain.mycompany.com) that points to a load balancer that directs traffic to one of many directory servers.  (Or, some companies might use DNS round robin.)  However, neither the use of DNS round robin nor use of an actual load balancer is supported by JIRA -- both approaches to load balancing direct traffic to different servers, which would violate limitation #2 above.
Currently, JIRA only supports connecting to a single directory server, not different (load-balanced) servers.
fields.summary: Support load-balanced LDAP/AD servers with JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24132].
  {panel}

Hi Guys,

Hopefully you can help with this issue I have relating to permissions 

Let me just give you a brief background to our system setup, we are using JIRA internationally for UK, FR, DE, AU and SG.  Each country has its own projects so as you can expect the list of projects is very long and quite scary for a normal user

What we want to do is have the projects listed related to the country so only users in FR can see FR Projects, this is obviously very easily accomplished with a group and the browse projects permissions BUT what we want to do is to also allow users to see the project from the other country if they are CC'ed or assigned to any of the bugs

Scenario:

FR bug opened by FR user in FR project
FR project and bug is hidden to UK User
FR user now adds the UK user as a CC
UK user can now see the relevant FR project for the bug they have been CC'ed on

At the moment if you add in "Current Assignee" + "Custom Field (CC)" into the browse permission the user cannot see the bugs themselves (unless they are the assignee or CC) BUT they see the project listed which it shouldn't be

Any way around this?

Thanks in advance,

Joe
fields.summary: Permissions Issue

Since JIRA 4.3 we have introduced new user management framework there is a chance that during reordering user directories 'random' users may loose their ability to perform task in their system. Or, even login to system.

We should produce a report finding all shadow (duplicated) users across all directories and present them to an administrator who is trying to reorder user directories.

There are correlated issues in the EMBCWD project for eg.

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/EMBCWD-783

fields.description:
Support often gets customers who due limited understanding of JAVA and JVM getting highly concern about the memory utilisation in JIRA.
!JVM_mem.png!

The stats are perceived as an indicator of a performance problem with JIRA. Below I've listed common is *misconceptions* about behaviour JVM and garbage collection:
- JIRA always uses 100% mem,
- I have to  'Force garbage collection' in order to release memory,
- JIRA feels slow and i noticed it uses all memory

By creating a doco page and link it to the product, we could help our users to understand the provided stats in a better way.
fields.summary: Add "Help" link on the "System Info" page

fields.description:
On initial JIRA startup integrated with MySQL the following errors are reported:
{noformat}
[... lots of table creations here ...]
2010-12-16 15:28:10,062 main WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "Worklog" has no table in the database
2010-12-16 15:28:10,218 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create declared indices for entity "GroupAttribute"
2010-12-16 15:28:10,218 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX idx_goup_attr_dir_name_lval ON cwd_group_attributes (directory_id, attribute_name, lower_attribute_value)
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes
SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uk_group_attr_name_lval ON cwd_group_attributes (group_id, attribute_name, lower_attribute_value)
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes
2010-12-16 15:28:10,288 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create declared indices for entity "Membership"
2010-12-16 15:28:10,289 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX idx_mem_dir_parent_child ON cwd_membership (lower_parent_name, lower_child_name, membership_type, directory_id)
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes
2010-12-16 15:28:10,425 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create declared indices for entity "UserAttribute"
2010-12-16 15:28:10,425 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX idx_user_attr_dir_name_lval ON cwd_user_attributes (directory_id, attribute_name, lower_attribute_value)
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes
2010-12-16 15:28:13,801 main INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger]
{noformat}

JIRA's performance may suffer if you have a large number of users and/or groups defined (even if they in an external directory).

h4. Cause

There is a known bug with MySQL related to MyISAM, the UTF8 character set and indexes:

* [http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=4541]

h4.Resolution
The resolution steps are different for new installation and for existing installations with data.

h5. Resolution for a New Installation

In this case we need to configure JIRA to use InnoDB before any of its tables are created.

# Before starting the application installation (i.e. none of JIRA's tables can already be created), ensure that you have followed the instructions provided in [Connecting JIRA to MySQL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL#ConnectingJIRAtoMySQL-configuringmysql].
# Ensure that the *InnoDB* Dialect is installed on your MySQL server.
# Change the storage engine used by JIRA so that new tables will always be created under InnoDB. There are two main ways of doing this:
** *Option 1*: Change MySQL settings*: Set the [default-storage-engine|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/storage-engine-setting.html] to InnoDB and restart MySQL. This makes InnoDB the default engine for all new tables on your MySQL instance. This could affect other applications using your MySQL instance.
** *Option2*: Change connection URL used for JIRA*: You can configure JIRA to use InnoDB by default by adding {{sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB}} to your JDBC URL in the {{[$JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]/dbconfig.xml}} file. This change will be isolated to JIRA. The location of the JDBC URL has changed between JIRA [4.3.x|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/VA0aDg#ConnectingJIRAtoMySQL-5.Configurethedatabaseconnectionmanually] and [4.4.x|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/0QESCw#ConnectingJIRAtoMySQL-4.2ConnectingJIRAtoMySQLManually]. For example:
{{jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?useUnicode=true&amp;characterEncoding=UTF8}} will be changed to  {{jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?useUnicode=true&amp;characterEncoding=UTF8&amp;sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB}}.
# Install JIRA.

h5. Resolution for existing JIRA installation having MyISAM tables with data

*Option 1: Migrate the MyISAM tables in place*

# Stop JIRA.
# Take a backup of your database in case things go wrong.
# Make sure that the *InnoDB* Dialect is installed on your MySQL server.
# Change the storage engine used by JIRA so that new tables will always be created under InnoDB with the following, as from [these docs|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/alter-table.html]:
{code:SQL}
ALTER TABLE t1 ENGINE = InnoDB;
{code}
# Migrate all JIRA's current tables to InnoDB. For example, you can:
** Run the following command to generate an SQL script that will migrate your tables from MyISAM to InnoDB: 
{noformat}
mysql -NBe "select concat('alter table ',  TABLE_NAME, ' engine = InnoDB;') from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES where TABLE_SCHEMA = '<database>' and engine = 'MyISAM'" -u <user> -p <database>
{noformat}
In this command {{<database>}} is the name of your database and {{<user>}} is a user who can access {{<database>}}.
** Check to generated script to ensure that it does not do anything you don't expect.
** Run the generated script. This can take some time.
# Restart JIRA.

*Option 2: Perform a JIRA backup and restore*

This will require taking an XML backup of JIRA and restoring it to a new database.

# Take an XML backup of JIRA.
# Stop JIRA.
# Make sure that the *InnoDB* Dialect is installed on your MySQL server.
# Change the storage engine used by JIRA so that new tables will always be created under InnoDB with the following, as from [these docs|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/alter-table.html]:
{code:SQL}
ALTER TABLE t1 ENGINE = InnoDB;
{code}
# Create a new database for JIRA.
# Configure JIRA to connect to the new database.
# Start JIRA.
# Restore the backup you took earlier.
fields.summary: MySQL Index Creation Fails With Error "specified key was too long"

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 5 January 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your vote, detailed thoughts and comments on this issue. 
 
Great news. This request is already addressed and our Cloud customers can benefit from it even today. For the JIRA Server customers: the feature will be delivered in the upcoming release of JIRA, which is going to be available really really soon. 
 
With that said, thank you all for for your patience and continued support and voting for this feature request. More enhancements to JIRA are coming soon.
 
Cheers,

Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

*Original request description*
 
When I have queried for a list of issues, I'd like to be able to use the bulk edit abilities to add a label to some/all of the issues. When adding a label, it overwrites/deletes any existing labels on the issue. Bulk editing of labels should be additive, or even better give an option to be additive or overwrite any existing.

Select and multi select fields width doesn't fits to options text length after upgrade from JIRA 4.0.2 to 4.2.2.
In 4.2.2 the width of fields are fixed on 250px in CSS file, which causes the text to be cut.

Steps to reproduce:

- Create options with 40 characters or more.
- Link this field to the default issue creation screen.
- Try to create a screen and figure that the text has been cut due to field width.

Check screenshots for further information around css files config provided by firebug.

This behavior appears in all browsers.

fields.description:
This problem is likely to be observed, if JIRA is integrated with Active Directory. Microsoft as part of their best practise recommendations encourage administrators to configure AD with 'LDAP server signing requirements'

On authentication attempts against an LDAP directory using this feature the following error is reported in the log file:
{noformat}
2011-02-26 22:24:14,337 http-9000-2 ERROR anonymous 1344x32x1 157zlkf 62.16.243.115,192.168.1.18 /rest/gadget/1.0/login 
[user.provider.ldap.LDAPCredentialsProvider] Could not connect to LDAP. Please check your host 
('ldap://nbcdc02.nordbotten.local:389'), bind DN ('CN=Administrator,CN=Users,DC=nordbotten,DC=local') and bind password.
javax.naming.AuthenticationNotSupportedException: [LDAP: error code 8 - 00002028: LdapErr: DSID-0C0901FC, comment: The server 
requires binds to turn on integrity checking if SSL\TLS are not already active on the connection, data 0, v1db1
{noformat}

Currently, our application doesn't provide any mechanism allowing us to talk with AD configured in this way. However, this problem can be worked around by:

   1. using Transport Layer Security/Secure Socket Layer (TLS/SSL) for the connection (LDAPS),
      JIRA 4.3+ - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory
      JIRA 4.2 - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA042/Integrating+JIRA+with+LDAP#IntegratingJIRAwithLDAP-LDAPoverSSL
   2. reconfiguring Active Directory Group Policy Security Setting "LDAP Server Signing Requirements",
      http://support.microsoft.com/kb/823659
fields.summary: JIRA can't communicate if LDAP server signing requirements used

fields.description:
When restoring a large backup (eg, JAC data) websudo will almost certainly timeout.  Let's say the backup failed due to invalid paths, on my machine, it took over 10 minutes for JIRA to return me this error.  So I'm shown a screen saying the restore failed, and I clicked the retry link to restore using the default paths.  It took me to the websudo login screen, and I had to login to websudo again, it then took me to the screen asking if I wanted to retry the last action.  This is weird, I just clicked retry, entered my password, and now I'm being asked to retry again?  So now I get stuck on this retry screen for half an hour waiting for my backup to be done, not being sure if I've done the right thing, or if I should go back to the backup screen and try again.

This wouldn't be an issue if the websudo filter updated the last accessed timestamp on the way out, rather than on the way in.
fields.summary: Websudo should update the last accessed time on request finish, not request start

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Start JIRA.
2. Without setting JIRA, shutdown JIRA.

Result:
1. User sees a "null pointer exception" in logs for shutting down JIRA.

Info From Brendan:

This is a race condition. MODZ detector now runs in the background after JIRA starts up. If you shutdown JIRA while it is running then you get this error.

We should create a bug but I don't think it will stop us shipping.
fields.summary: JIRA shutdown with "Null pointer exception" if user quickly shutdown after starting it

fields.description: I got an error after clicking Synchronise when connected to crowd-ad1 (because I hadn't done the DNS setup mentioned on https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/LDAP+Servers). When I click Synchronise again nothing actually happens. If I reload the page, then clicking Synchronise works again.
fields.summary: error during LDAP Synchronise means you have to reload page for Synchronise to work again

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA as sysadmin.
2. Goto Admin->FishEye Configuration. The user already a fisheye instance configured.

Result:
1. There is a new clear option which shows user how to another fisheye/crucible instance to JIRA.
2. Till JIRA 4.2.4 we used to give an option "Add Another FishEye Instance" on same page.
fields.summary: Fisheye plugin now don't give sysadmin users option to add another fisheye instance

h3. Resolution

As in [the below comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tcampbell]:

{quote}
This is caused by a race condition, when 2 (or more) threads try and access a directory at the same time before the Directory Instance has been instantiated. There appear to be no harmful side effects beyond the log messages.
{quote}

fields.description: In 4.2 and earlier, there is a tab on the OAuth screen for configuring OAuth Service Providers. These are not upgraded via UAL and the existing links cannot be viewed or modified via the standard interface. There is a workaround (going directly to the old OAuth screen) but this would require Support assistance.
fields.summary: OAuth Service Provider data is not upgraded or visible in UAL

fields.description:
Jira team: I don't know what sub-team to assign bugs to. The names are not evident, I found no direction and I can't submit with "None". I put it to Engine Room, based on Penny's suggestion.

- Browser 1: Add an LDAP directory to Jira.
- Browser 1: Make sure the LDAP user can login to JIRA and can update issues.
- Browser 2: Login with the LDAP user.
- Browser 2:Go to edit an issue.
- Browser 1: While the issue is in edit mode, go to the User Directories admin screen and disable the LDAP directory.
- Browser 2: Click on Update on the issue. You will get an error saying that the session has expired (see image 1)
- Browser 2: Click on "Log In" to go to login screen
- Browser 1: In the User Directories admin screen re-enable the LDAP directory
- Browser 2: Login with the user. You will get an error screen saying that "XSRF Security Token Missing. (see image 2)
- Click on the "Retry Operation" button.

*Expected:* I am not sure if the issue update is supposed to complete, or redirection to the issue page.

*Actual:*  com.atlassian.jira.exception.IssueNotFoundException: Issue with id 'null' or key 'null' could not be found in the system
fields.summary: Misleading error message when a logged-in user gets removed.

fields.description: Basically this says that fix JRADEV-4192 does not work on Oracle and MSSQL databases. Reason: {{DefaultChangeHistoryManager.findAllPossibleValues}} generates a query over columns of ChangeItem table assuming they are some kind of strings. Gadgets only appear in the gadget directory if they have been whitelisted.
This means that if you are trying to remove a directory and remove the whitelist entry first, you can't see it in the directory in order to remove it.

In practice, it has been removed, although you'll keep getting these errors in the logs every time you open the directory:
{noformat}
2011-02-02 16:38:01,368 http-9090-4 WARN admin 998x2514x1 1485iot 172.20.9.100 /secure/Dashboard.jspa [renderer.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] A request to http://hosting.gmodules.com/ig/gadgets/file/112581010116074801021/hamster.xml has been denied.  To allow requests to this URL add the application URL to your whitelist (http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KQfCDQ ).

fields.description:
Jira team: I believe this to be a JIRA bug because this scenario does not reproduce in Confluence when it is linked to Crowd.

- Add an LDAP directory to Crowd. Make sure to have the "jira-users", "jira-administrators" and "jira-developers" groups exist in LDAP.
- Add Crowd Server as a directory to Jira, set it as the first directory.
- Add a user in Jira. Notice that in the LDAP server, the jira-users group will show the new user.
- Delete the user from Jira

*Expected:* The entry in the jira-users group in LDAP to be deleted.

*Actual:* The entry is not removed. "jira-users" group is left with an entry that does not point to any users.
fields.summary: Deleting a user does not remove the user from its LDAP group

fields.description:
1) Go to the UAL configuration screen.
2) Click "Configure" on an applink.
3) Click "Close" (i.e. cancel)

At this point, the whole Applink table reloads. Even running locally, this takes 3-4 seconds and is an unnecessary wait, as no changes could have been saved. If you're just trying to look through things quickly, such as comparing the configuration of two links, it takes ages.
fields.summary: UAL Configuration screen reloads when no changes were made

fields.description:
If a JIRA user comes from a read-only directory, the Reset Password functional is still available on the login screen, but it throws an error.

1) Configure a user from a read-only directory (such as any user in JDog).
2) From the login screen click "Can't access your account?"
3) Click "Password" and enter the user name. Click "Send".
4) Follow the link from the email that was received.
5) Enter a new password and click "Reset".

!ResetPasswordReadOnly.png!

We disable the "Change Password" function when a user comes from a read-only directory, we should also disable "Reset Password".

Unless it's a security risk, I think the best time to do this would be after Step 3 - to show an error along the lines of "This user account is read-only, please contact your system administrator", instead of sending the email.
fields.summary: Error thrown when attempting to reset the password of a user from a read-only directory

fields.description:
If I use the [issueLink|http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/api/latest/issueLink] REST resource to try to create an Issue Link, and the link exists then I get a *200 OK* response.
This surprised me a little, but I don't hate it.

However, when I do the same thing and include a comment, then the comment gets added to the issue and I get the *200 OK* response.
This one definitely seems strange as we probably only wanted the comment added if we were the actual ones adding the comment.
fields.summary: Should 'Issue Link Create' REST resource return "200 OK" if the link already exists?

fields.description:
I don't like the idea of sending in POST body username to add such watcher, while to remove a watcher we use URI for DELETE method.

To be consistent and more intuitive for RESTful geeks, I think we should:
- PUT <issue-key>/watchers/<username> to add a watcher
- DELETE <issue-key>/watchers/<username> to remove a watcher
- POST <issue-key>/watchers to add yourself as a watcher 
- DELETE <issue-key>/watchers to remove yourself from the watcher list
The last two are optional, although the most typical scenario is adding yourself as a watcher or removing yourself. With potentially crazy authentication scenarios (like OAuth or SSL client cert) rest client may not even know its name, so he will need to first get his current session details just to find out what his username is and only then use this name to add or remove themselves as a watcher. That's an unnecessary call, which we could avoid by adding this POST without username.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Improving consistency of watchers related methods

fields.description:
Current behaviour:
* when accessed anonymously I get 404 for a project which cannot be browsed anonymously (Group: {{Anyone}} in JIRA.  At the same time, REST gives me the hint that:
{quote}
"You must have the browse project permission to view this project."
{quote}
* when authenticated, but the user does not have the access to selected project, I get 404 too.

This is IMO inconsistent with [RFC2616|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html] guidelines for using 403 vs. 404.
If we want to protect/hide the existence of a resource (project) which cannot be accessed anonymously or by the current user, we should say 404 without further hints. If we want to indicate that the user must be authenticated first, we should use 401, and if the user is already authenticated we should use 403. In both cases we should then include the message (the same which is sent now).

JIRA web UI does not hide the existence of the projects inaccessible anonymously or by the authenticated (but unauthorized) user, so we should do the same in REST too.
fields.summary: Error codes and message returned for failed attempts to access project resource are not conforming to RFC guidelines.

fields.description:
That is to say we allow a customer to setup their instance so that people do not need to log in and that these same people can then change things at an admin level.

Surely this is a case of allowing the customer to f*ck themselves, I cant see a potential benefit to this.
fields.summary: Anonymous user (or "Anyone") can be granted admin privileges and should not.

fields.description:
- Jira 1 (server): Add an LDAP directory and set it to the top.
- Jira 1 (server): Setup as a crowd server and define application name.
- Jira 2 (client): Add JaaCS to directories and move it to the top.
- Jira 1 (server): Change the application name and the IP addresses to some other random values
- Jira 2 (client): Attempt to sync the Crowd Server user directory

*Expected*: Error since application can no longer authenticate with JaaCS
	
*Actual*: Synchronization succeeds

fields.description:
I am logging this to catch any scenario which I am not able to predict. JIRA behind firewall/or running with proxy.

Steps:
1. I have 2 JIRA instances running on my machine(UAL compliant).
2. Accessing the 1st one from my VM as http://vbharara:8080. Now try to create a application link. Input server URL as "localhost:8099/jira". It works without issue for adding of new application links(selected 2 way connection). Now click "Configure" to configure it. Click on "Outgoing authentication". 

Result:
1.For "Trusted Application" and "OAuth tab", its usual browser can't display webpage kind of error. Snapshot attached.
2. A better handling or error message is required to let user know what was wrong.
fields.summary: Error handling is not proper in "configure" dialog when server is able to connect to the application but not the client.

fields.description:
1) Go to the issue nav.
2) Configure your columns so that there is a horizontal scrollbar.
3) Perform a search in advanced mode.

After loading, the advanced search box changes size, forcing the viewport to scroll to the left.

This definitely affects IE8 and not FireFox. I have not been able to check it in other browsers, but odds are it's IE-specific.

This issue does not affect 4.2.4 or simple search mode.

Video here: http://screencast.com/t/vhJBVLoyKZt
fields.summary: Issue nav auto-scrolls to the right in advanced search mode in IE8
